security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill containing only YAML examples and guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. Pure informational content for authoring architecture diagram YAML files.

content.value_statement: Writing YAML for infrastructure diagrams can be error-prone with cryptic validation errors. This skill provides clear syntax guides, examples, and troubleshooting for Figram YAML diagrams so you can create AWS architecture diagrams without guessing.
actual_capabilities: Write valid YAML for AWS architecture diagrams
Configure nodes with providers, kinds, and layouts
Nest resources inside VPC and subnet containers
Use auto-layout for automatic node positioning
limitations: Limited to AWS provider examples shown

best_practices: Use descriptive node IDs like 'user-api' instead of 'n1' for clarity
Nest resources inside VPC/Subnet containers to organize complex architectures
Child nodes can omit layout for automatic grid-based positioning
Add comments with '#' to document purpose of each component
anti_patterns: Using duplicate node IDs causing validation errors
Specifying only x or y coordinate without the other
Forgetting that container nodes (VPC, Subnet) require width and height
Not quoting labels with spaces or special characters

faq.question: What providers are supported?
faq.answer: Figram supports AWS, GCP, and Azure. Use 'provider: aws', 'gcp', or 'azure' in node definitions.

faq.question: Can I use auto-layout for child nodes?
faq.answer: Yes. Child nodes with a 'parent' field can omit layout entirely for automatic positioning in a grid.

faq.question: How do I nest resources inside a VPC?
faq.answer: Set the 'parent' field on child nodes to reference the VPC or subnet node ID. Child nodes position relative to their parent.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides YAML syntax guidance. No data is sent anywhere. All processing happens locally via the Figram CLI.

faq.question: Why am I getting 'Missing required field version'?
faq.answer: Every diagram YAML must start with 'version: 1' and include a unique 'docId' at the document root level.

faq.question: How is this different from drawing in FigJam directly?
faq.answer: YAML authoring lets you version control diagrams, use text editors you prefer, and rapidly generate consistent architectures without manual positioning.
